Text: Accessing your Outlook email at home Cc Cindy informed me that your are having some difficulties accessing your Outlook email from home and from locations outside the Enron Building Here are some instructions that will help you get in Make sure you are connected to the Enron network If you are at home and use dialup to get into Enron dialin as you normally would to get the connection If you are in another Enron office you should be fine Open Internet Explorer By default this usually takes you to homeenroncom Change the address to mailenroncom A login screen will appear asking for an ID and a password In the ID box type CORPshorton case is not important In the password blank type in your network password This is the password you use to login to your machine each morning When you change your network password your Outlook password will automatically change with it You should now see your Outlook inbox You can access your mail your calendar and your contacts If you have any further questions please let me know Regards Mike Hernandez Technical Lead Risk Management Integration
